physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Reduced muscle strength in finger spread, extension, and flexion on both sides graded 42/5; toe extensors 24/24, toe flexors 24/4; absent reflexes throughout; reduced sensation to all modalities in a length-dependent pattern up to mid-shin and wrists bilaterally; severely unsteady when walking; positive Romberg; high arches and hammertoes.

Nerve conduction studies showed absent sensory responses; prolonged motor distal latencies (arm DL 16-27 ms, leg DL 14-26 ms); marked prolonged compound muscle action potential durations (median nerve 45 ms distally, 50 ms proximally; tibial nerve 47 ms distally, 53 ms proximally); abnormal spontaneous activity on EMG.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Nerve conduction and EMG findings suggest a superimposed inflammatory process.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Profound improvement of distal latency, amplitude, and duration in follow-up nerve conduction studies.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Significant improvement of nerve conduction parameters after treatment with IVIg.
